history.proof: unfold dfun_leq. qsimpl time: 1 use: fun_refl.

exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x Unable to unify "?M1464 -> ?M1465" with "A".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
B: A -> poset
x: forall x : A, B x

Goal:
dfun_leq x x

Premises:
dfun_leq : (forall x : A, B x) -> (forall x : A, B x) -> Prop
Sub : forall x0 : ?T, ?P x0 -> ?sT where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type] ?P : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- pred ?T] ?sT : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- subType ?P]
snd : ?A * ?B -> ?B where ?A : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type] ?B : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
Mem : ?pT -> Mem_Pred ?T where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type] ?pT : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- PredType ?T]
fst : ?A * ?B -> ?A where ?A : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type] ?B : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
pair : ?A -> ?B -> ?A * ?B where ?A : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type] ?B : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
size : seq ?T -> nat where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
eq_op : rel ?T where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- eqType]
[::] : seq ?T where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
nseq : nat -> ?T -> seq ?T where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
all : pred ?T -> seq ?T -> bool where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
rotr : nat -> seq ?T -> seq ?T where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
cons : ?T -> seq ?T -> seq ?T where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type]
fext : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (f1 f2 : forall x : A, B x), (forall x : A, f1 x = f2 x) -> f1 = f2
Relation_Operators.clos_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
SubType : forall (sub_sort : Type) (val : sub_sort -> ?T) (Sub : forall x0 : ?T, ?P x0 -> sub_sort), (forall K : sub_sort -> Type, (forall (x0 : ?T) (Px : ?P x0), K (Sub x0 Px)) -> forall u : sub_sort, K u) -> (forall (x0 : ?T) (Px : ?P x0), val (Sub x0 Px) = x0) -> subType ?P where ?T : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- Type] ?P : [A : Type B : A -> poset x : forall x : A, B x |- pred ?T]
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_trans _%type_scope
pair_asym : forall (A B : poset) (x y : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y x -> x = y
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
pair_trans : forall (A B : poset) (x y z : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y z -> pair_leq x z
pair_refl : forall (A B : poset) (x : A * B), pair_leq x x
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
pair_leq : forall A B : poset, A * B -> A * B -> Prop
fun_asym : forall (A : Type) (B : poset) (x y : A -> B), fun_leq x y -> fun_leq y x -> x = y
fun_refl : forall (A : Type) (B : poset) (x : A -> B), fun_leq x x
fun_trans : forall (A : Type) (B : poset) (x y z : A -> B), fun_leq x y -> fun_leq y z -> fun_leq x z
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments Poset.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Poset.Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
